comments.body:
golint recommends renaming this interface to `Actions` to prevent stutter. This is the last violation remaining in the package and seems reasonable, but would break the interface for consumers. A quick search of users inside the repo shows only 2 uses:
```
vendor/github.com/kubernetes/repo-infra/kazel/kazel.go
613:	options := []string{"limitranger.LimitRangerActions", "BUILD"}

vendor/github.com/bazelbuild/bazel-gazelle/internal/config/config.go
93:var DefaultValidBuildFileNames = []string{"limitranger.LimitRangerActions", "BUILD"}
```

what about walkaround by renaming package like:
> package limitrangeradmission
That could work. I haven't addressed this yet in case there are other opinions. I'll tackle that once tests are green again.

> This is the last violation remaining in the package and seems reasonable, but would break the interface for consumers

renaming the package also breaks the interface
I assume this is when a limit is referencing a custom type?
Yes, used to filter limit ranges that only apply to images downstream: https://github.com/openshift/origin/pull/7989/files#diff-c0324af3f9610f91b1fde15a63e35bf5R118
